About two hours south of Bangkok, the Aleenta Hua Hin Resort & Spa has introduced a sustainable culinary program called Carbon Free Cooking. The chef James Noble sources only organic produce from within a 30-kilometer radius of the resort and uses bicycles or tuk-tuks powered by fuel made from recycled cooking oil to transport vegetables, meat and other provisions to the 23-room beachfront resort. In the kitchen, he uses solar ovens, smokehouses, clay pots buried in hot sand and molecular cooking techniques to keep the carbon footprint of his dishes small. A seven-night Gourmet Getaway Package includes three four-course cooking classes, a farm tour and airport transfers to and from Bangkok, from $210 per night.
